items.title: Nightmare at 39 Pearl Street: A Clerical Error Quadruples Taxes
items.abstract: New York admits it sometimes makes mistakes in collecting property taxes — but it still fights to keep the money.

items.title: Cities Mobilize to Help Those Threatened by Gentrification
items.abstract: While still eager to have young professionals move to blighted areas, cities are recognizing the toll that rising tax assessments can have on longtime working-class residents.

items.title: New York City Students Show Slight Gains on Test Scores
items.abstract: Results from a national testing program revealed a steady but incremental improvement in student performance during the Bloomberg era.

items.title: Detroit’s Emergency Manager Offers Dire Report on City
items.abstract: Kevyn D. Orr, the emergency manager, called for a complete restructuring of Detroit’s finances and described long-term obligations of at least $15 billion.

items.title: Start-Ups Use Technology to Redesign the Hiring Process
items.abstract: Algorithms can help remove bias from the traditional résumé-sifting process and level the playing field for applicants.
